title: Telegraph Travel Awards 2015/16: win a £48,000 break in Mexico and Germany
text: Esperanza, an Auberge Resort, on the Baja peninsula in Mexico, provided the backdrop for President Obama’s G20 summit in 2012. Meanwhile Schloss Elmau Luxury Spa, Retreat & Cultural Hideaway hosted this year’s G7. The two have got together to offer the chance to stay where the world leaders do, with a five-night stay for two in a beachfront luxury suite at Esperanza and a stay for two couples for four nights in the Summit and Tower Suite at Schloss Elmau, where David Cameron stayed during the G7. How to enter Follow this link to tell us about your favourite travel companies and destinations - and to enter the draw for one of 27 prizes . You will need to leave your name, telephone number and a valid email address. See here for full terms and conditions . Esperanza Loved by Hollywood A Listers and Barack Obama's accommodation of choice and the location of his and his delegates private meetings at the G20 summit, the award winning Esperanza, an Auberge Resort, based on the Baja peninsula, is offering a prize worth £26,000 which offers the winner the chance to step into a world where at breakfast you will be sat next to Presidents and Oscar winners. The prize The award winning Relais & Chateaux Esperanza, an Auberge Resort, is offering a 5 night stay for 2 in a beachfront luxury suite, including 24 hour butler service, private round trip airport transfers, daily breakfast at the seafront Cocina del Mar, Tequila Tasting for 2, Dinner for 2 at Cocina del Mar, 2 60 Minute Massages, Yacht Excursion (Whale Watching Seasonal). Spread along seventeen acres of Mexico’s unspoilt nature and the tranquil Baja Peninsula, the 57 room Esperanza, a private beach resort, reopened this summer after a year long renovation. Peppered with original art and furnishings made by expert local craftsmen, including its own sculpture garden and private bean, the refurbished Esperanza possesses an individual and authentic charm that still honours the modernity of all its world-class amenities. Just a short flight from Los Angeles, Esperanza is the weekend getaway for the who's who in Hollywood. Pre oscars it is not unusual to have famous faces in the hotel's world-renowned spa being preened and pampered in order to be red carpet ready. During the whaling season guests can see the grey whale migration from the comfort of their breakfast table, those keen for a closer look can arrange yacht excursions to ride along side the whales and have a ring side seat to this remarkable event. The southern Baja subtropical desert climate offers a blissful 350 days of sunshine a year, providing the perfect back drop for the various activities Esperanza's setting offers, whether its surfing, whale watching, golf, desert racing or beach yoga, guests can refuel at one of the 6 restaurants at the hotel, which includes freshest local ingredients with cuisine from Mexico, the US, a ceviche bar and Italian, www.esperanza.aunergeresorts.com Contact : Jerri Lyn Walker, Sales & Marketing Director, email: jerrilyn.walker@aubergeresorts.com The prize providers Auberge Resorts Collection owns and operates a portfolio of exceptional acclaimed hotels, resorts, and residences. Auberge Resorts Collection include: Auberge du Soleil and Calistoga Ranch, Napa Valley, Calif.; Esperanza, Cabo San Lucas, Mexico; Hotel Jerome, Aspen; Malliouhana, Anguilla; Hacienda AltaGracia, Costa Rica; Nanuku, Fiji; The Auberge Residences at Element 52, Telluride; VieVage, Napa Valley; VieVage, Baja (Los Cabos); and Auberge Beach Residences and Spa, with several others in development. Auberge nurtures the individuality of each property, all share a crafted approach to luxury that is expressed through captivating design, exceptional cuisine and spas, and gracious yet unobtrusive service. For more information about Auberge Resorts Collection, please see www.aubergeresorts.com . Terms and conditions Valid 1 year from contest closing (not valid over US holidays and subject to availability) Schloss Elmau Its not every day that you can say you slept in the same bed as one of the leaders of the free world! Yet Schloss Elmau Luxury Spa, Retreat & Cultural Hideaway are offering just that, the chance to win a stay in the Summit and Tower Suite were David Cameron stayed during this year's G7. The prize worth £22,000 allows the winner to walk in the footsteps of all of the 7 leaders, whilst experiencing the award winning spa and cuisine, surrounded by unspoilt nature and the dramatic views of the Wetterstein Mountains. The prize The award winning Schloss Elmau Luxury Spa, Retreat & Cultural Hideaway are offering an exclusive stay for 2 couples for 4 nights in the Summit and Tower (David Cameron's Suite). As well as a private gourmet dinner from their Michelin Starred Chef, a private Thai Dinner, a private Lunch at the Mountain Hut with a private guide to the top of the mountain. Private access to the multiple award winning Spa for one night (with food and Champagne) as well as 4 spa treatments per room (8 spa treatments). A private transfer to and from the Airport and a private driver to local attractions and Castles, which include King Ludwig II's famed Castle, the Linderhof Palace and the Zugspitze Railway, which takes you to the highest Mountain in Germany.The competition winner and their guests will also be able to enjoy the hotel's concert programme, previous musicians have included Wolfgang Haffner, Gregory Sokolov, Gregory Porter among many others. Located in the Bavarian Alps, a 30 minute drive from Innsbruck, Schloss Elmau Luxury Spa, Retreat & Cultural Hideaway is a fairy-tale-esque mountain hotel, The new Retreat, which opened in March this year in grounds of the current hotel and which hosted the G7 Summit in June, boats a 50,000 sq ft spa (they have 90,000 sq ft of spa in total including the spa at the Schloss), Finnish saunas and a heated pool with dramatic views over the snowy peaks of the Wetterstein Mountains. Guests will also have access to the spa at the Schloss which is home to the largest Hammam outside of Turkey. With laden bookshelves and libraries dotted around the castle, Schloss Elmau attracts a cultured crowd, the over 200 yearly concerts that are performed in the hotel's very own concert hall attract world class musicians, from some of the most respected jazz and classical artists to up and coming stars. Daily yoga classes are practiced in the glass walled yoga pavilions, and regularly sees some of the world's leading yogis teaching at the hotel. To feel even more at one with nature the hotel's setting provides an abundance of hiking trails with a mix of easy-to-navigate forest paths or guided mountain tours enable less experienced hikers to navigate more advanced routes with ease. In the winter you can enjoy cross-country skiing directly from the hotel, while the slopes are only 20 minutes away. After a long day of activities or relaxing in the spa, guests can choose from 9 restaurants, including Italian, Thai, Fondue and the Michelin Star Luce D'Oro to name a few. www.schloss-elmau.de Contact : Nikolai Bloyd, General Manager, email: Nikolai-bloyd@schloss-elmau.de Terms and conditions The prize is valid subject to availability from a Sunday to Friday stay in season C or D which includes, 17th January to 5th February, 14th February to 18th March, 3rd to 28th April, 1st to 4th May, 8th to 13th May, 29th May to 4th June, 12th June to 1st July, 28th August to 14th September, 18th to 23rd September, 3rd to 6th October, 6th to 15th November, 4th to 22nd December)prize to be claimed within one year of the competition closing. The prize provider Schloss Elmau was built in 1916 by Johannes Müller. Originally intended to be an artistic community, where 'Helpers' (not employees) cared for visiting guests, whilst hosting world-famous artists of all genres. In 2007 the resort had a 100€ million refurbishment. Today, the hotel still holds the tradition of inviting world-renowned artists, particularly musicians, to perform at Elmau. Cellist Sol Gabette, clarinettist Sabine Meyer, and conductor Gidon Kremer appear regularly, and over the years legendary musicians such as violinist Yehudi Menuhin, soprano Barbara Hendricks, and pianistMitsuko Uchida have headlined evening concerts. The CEO and Owner, Dietmar Elmau is now leading the property into his family's third generation of ownership. Telegraphtravel
